thread.title: US sanctions Venezuela vice-president over trafficking claims
thread.title_full: US sanctions Venezuela vice-president over trafficking claims

title: US sanctions Venezuela vice-president over trafficking claims
text:
Image copyright AFP Image caption Tareck el-Aissami was appointed last month by President Nicolas Maduro The US has imposed sanctions on the new vice-president of Venezuela, accusing him of involvement in international drug trafficking. 
The order adds Tareck el-Aissami to the US narcotics "kingpin" sanctions list "for playing a significant role in international narcotics trafficking". 
Sanctions were also slapped on wealthy businessman Samark Bello, described as Mr Aissami's "primary frontman". 
Mr Aissami was appointed last month by President Nicolas Maduro. 
The sanctions freeze the vice-president's assets in the US and bar him from entering the country. 
Mr Aissami has reportedly been under investigation in the US for alleged links to drug traffickers and to militants in the Middle East, according to sources quoted by US media. 
He was previously the governor of Aragua state and served as minister of the interior and justice in Venezuela from 2008 to 2012. 
Neither Mr Assaimi nor Mr Bello has responded to the sanctions.
